description:
When Light Yagami finds a notebook giving him power over death, will he use it for good—or evil?

Light Yagami is an ace student with great prospects—and he’s bored out of his mind. But all that changes when he finds the Death Note, a notebook dropped by a rogue Shinigami death god. Any human whose name is written in the notebook dies, and Light has vowed to use the power of the Death Note to rid the world of evil. But will Light succeed in his noble goal, or will the Death Note turn him into the very thing he fights against?

(Source: Viz Media)

title.native: DEATH NOTE アナザーノート ロサンゼルスBB連続殺人事件

name.native: アンソニー・カーター

node.description:
[Twitter](https://x.com/T_Obata_info) | [Twitter (Old)](https://twitter.com/obata_ten)

Takeshi Obata is a Japanese manga artist that usually works as the illustrator in collaboration with a writer. He first gained international attention for [Hikaru no Go](https://anilist.co/manga/30020/Hikaru-no-Go/) (1998–2003) with [Yumi Hotta](https://anilist.co/staff/96889/Yumi-Hotta), but is better known for [Death Note](https://anilist.co/manga/30021/Death-Note/) (2003–2006) and [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/manga/39711/Bakuman/) (2008–2012) with [Tsugumi Ohba](https://anilist.co/staff/97111/Tsugumi-Ohba). Obata has mentored several well-known manga artists, including [Nobuhiro Watsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96890/Nobuhiro-Watsuki) of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/manga/30022/Rurouni-Kenshin-Meiji-Kenkaku-Romantan/) fame, [Black Cat](https://anilist.co/manga/30040/Black-Cat/) creator [Kentaro Yabuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96900/Kentarou-Yabuki), and [Eyeshield 21](https://anilist.co/manga/30043/Eyeshield-21/) artist [Yusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903/Yusuke-Murata).

Tsugumi Ooba is a fictional writer credited with writing the manga Death Note. Their real identity (and gender) is a closely guarded secret

Day and night, develops manga plots while holding knees on a chair (reminiscent of one of the main characters in Death Note, L.)

They like to collect teacups.

(Source: VIZ Media)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marcbernabe) |  [Official Website](https://www.japonesenvinetas.com)

He is a translator and interpreter of Japanese, with special emphasis on the translation of manga and anime, a field in which he has a background of hundreds of volumes and episodes translated. In addition, he's a  specialist in didactics of the Japanese language and culture for Spanish speakers. He also has published many books about Japan and Asia.

He is famous for appearing in a Shin-chan's episode where the family goes to Spain.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pawel_dybala)
Besides translation, he also does lectures and research at the Jagiellonian University in Kraków. Works with publishers J.P.Fantastica and Egmont Poland.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/giacomocalorio/)
Giacomo Calorio is a Japanese to Italian translator who works on mangas, but also does academic research on topics linked to Japanese.
A French letterer and touch-up artist.
Worked as an assistant for Masanori Morita on Rookies, Yuusuke Murata on Eyeshield 21 and Takeshi Obata on both Hikaru no Go and Death Note.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ordbilder) | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kami-anani-055a5226/)

Starting his career in the manga sphere in 2008 by translating the Swedish edition of *Death Note*, his publishing company Ordbilder Media – which he inherited from his father – would go on to play a historic role in the Swedish manga industry. When all of the major publishers – Bonnier Carlsen, Egmont, etc. – shut down their manga publishing efforts entirely between 2008 and 2013 due to the global financial crisis, Ordbilder would go on to be the only company to translate manga translated to Swedish for most of the 2010s. Since he then hired an old acquaintance from the '00s to translate for his company, this would also be what cemented My Bergström as the longest-working manga translator in Sweden.
